item.title: Report E-2024070396
item.description:
Report E-2024070396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1824 was punctured in transit by other freight and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack. Crews deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt and swept them up with hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon drums of neutralized product and any cleanup debris, and the one (1) 95-gallon overpack of the damaged drum were staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070424
item.description:
Report E-2024070424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-quart of Gray Primer released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and the proper PPE available onsite. Terminal personnel placed the waste into a 20-gallon poly drum in the facilities waste area for disposal.
